titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I finished after a fashion the article for the
, and dispatched it. Then I went across to the Bank, and instructed the manager to invest
inquiring what weight I ought to attach to the statements of Judge
came to lunch, and afterwards walked with me round the Park. Everything looks ravishingly beautiful.
Then, at 4 p.m., I confirmed in the Chapel,
, aged respectively 18 and 14, who are leaving for Canada this week.
, the Vicar of Crook, came with them, & afterwards they all had tea.
and I motored to Burnhope, where I confirmed 83 persons in the mean little parish church. The parson,

, is clearly developing in the Anglo–Catholick direction. Two boys who, being under 14, I examined before the service, crossed themselves when repeating the Creed, & prated about Seven Sacraments in a very unblushing manner.
, strutted about in cassock and biretta. Why cannot they work the Prayer–book 'without frills'?
, my new Head–gardener, entered on his duties today; and hopes to enter into possession of his house tomorrow.
